CatDescriptText: Mrs. William Miller, housewife, 1010 Premier Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1959, pg. 6 with question: "With Mayor Lawrence performing his duties as Governor in Harrisburg, do you believe the Democratic party in Pittsburgh will be weakened by his absence?" answer reads: "I don't think so.  There probably will be another Democratic mayor.  If he does as well as Mayor Lawrence, everything should work out very nicely.  I think that the city, in general, hates to lose Mayor Lawrence."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. William Miller wearing earrings and light colored button down fuzzy coat, holding dark handbag handle over right wrist, standing corner of Perry with Poole's Funeral Home in background
